events.title: Great Chicago Fire Begins
events.description: A massive fire starts in Chicago, Illinois, ultimately destroying a large portion of the city and causing significant loss of life and property.
events.significance: Led to major urban rebuilding efforts and improved fire safety regulations.

events.title: Suez Crisis Begins
events.description: Israeli forces invade Egypt, marking the start of the Suez Crisis, a conflict involving Egypt, Israel, Britain, and France over control of the Suez Canal.
events.significance: Highlighted Cold War tensions and reshaped Middle Eastern geopolitics.

events.title: First Balkan War: Battle of Kumanovo
events.description: Serbian and Montenegrin forces defeat the Ottoman army, marking a decisive battle in the First Balkan War.
events.significance: Influenced the outcome of the First Balkan War and weakened Ottoman presence in Europe.

events.title: Thurgood Marshall Nominated to the U.S. Supreme Court
events.description: President Lyndon B. Johnson nominates Thurgood Marshall as the first African American justice of the Supreme Court of the United States.
events.significance: A landmark moment in civil rights and American judicial history.
